dialogues.text: I am looking for --

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: A list... It is the desire of you and every foreign officer.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Do you know who has it?

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: Some say Bakhtin has it others say he doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: No one knows. All this talk of Satchel has people nervous on both sides of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: If Bakhtin or the list surface you must let me know.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: The price will be extremely high.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We will not be outbid. Broughton hands Merkel a fist full of Deutschmarks.  58. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Five thousand marks to get you started. Broughton moves across the rooftop and down the dilapidat staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton laces the wire and SN mirco recording device ba onto her body with flawless detail. Checks herself in the mirror, grabs her coat, and is out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Watchmaker is busy at work, when a solitary man enter the shop and moves towards the back to speak to him. Only when the man arrives do we reveal it is Bakhtin.

dialogues.speaker: BAKHTIN
dialogues.text: I am interested in selling a watch? The watchmaker continues his accurate work.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAKER
dialogues.text: Tell me what you are selling?

dialogues.speaker: BAKHTIN
dialogues.text: It’s extremely valuable and the finest quality. The watchmaker looks up at Bakhtin.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAKER
dialogues.text: You have my complete attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon signs are bright. The KaDaWe department store is open late, and all is bustling along the kKurfiirstendamm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a leather bar. On the wall, a mural-sized painting o young Ronald Reagan in biker chaps 4 la “Daddy and the Mu Academy” by Tom of Finland. We hear “You Spin Me Round” by Dead or Alive PLAYING on a JUKEBOX.  The room is filled with men enjoying men and women women. Save for Perceval and Broughton, who sit in vinyl booth against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Berlin is like a beautiful woman gone bad.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: That why you like it here so much?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Nowhere else in the world has such a concentration of musicians, artists, filthy squatters, junkies, and hedonists. I don’t like it here. I love Berlin. 59. enjoying a red Broughton looks across at two men wearing full dress whit clearly more Village People than US military.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Spyglass left us a message. We guarantee safe passage, and he will cross over.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Why take the risk when we can just wait until the Wall comes down? Perceval raises his beer, about to drink.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: The entire Soviet bloc is on edge. Haven’t you seen the bloody protests on the news?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I saw one this morning on Unter den Linden. Perceval stares at her, his beer still as stone in front him. He slowly lowers the glass.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You went to the East? What in the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: That it was best you didn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Why not?  60.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Deniability. Perceval leans forward for impact.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: This isn’t a goddamn game. NATO has over ten thousand warheads, and the Russians have half that number. Perceval stares at Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So while you skip around the East, try and grasp the blowback if something were to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, and I needed to secure the trust of my contact.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You can’t trust the Frenchie?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: This contact is a man.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Well now, you are playing all the angles.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We need ground truth to find that list. I won’t need to go over again.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: On the contrary. Spyglass is in hiding and desperate to get out. Gascione’s death has everybody jumpy. Right now, the people in the Stasi don’t know if they’re going to be staring at a firing squad or freedom.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: This is my first time in Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I’m not sure if I believe you. Broughton leans back into the booth slightly.  61.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Believe what you want.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Spyglass is an asset that we can’t lose. Right now, he is scared, and scared people make mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We need him out before the KGB or the Stasi discover his treason. Perceval quickly scans around their table and firmly grab Broughton’s arm to get her attention.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. I’m still your number one, and you work for me. Broughton says nothing, only looks at Perceval’s hand on bicep. Perceval gets the point and releases his grip.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Don’t ever touch me again. Now you listen. I am here on C’s direct orders. My work does concern you, but you’re mistaken to think it’s under your purview. Broughton stands and shoulders her winter coat. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) I don’t have to take orders from you. So with all due respect, you can go fuck yourself. Broughton walks out the door without another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold rain. Perceval steps outside as Broughton walks down sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (to herself) Come on... 3... 2... 1... Perceval jogs after her.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Wait.  62. Perceval catches up to Broughton at a taxi stand.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t operate alone on this one.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: So get the American. Kurzfeld seems happy to share your bed.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Out of the question. The Americans would have Spyglass on an aircraft back to Langley without his feet ever touching the ground. I need your help. Perceval extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Truce? Broughton takes a moment, and then her hand meets his.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Don’t make me regret it. Broughton releases his hand, opens the taxi door and gest for Perceval to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton looks to the German TAXI DRIVER and then to Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Kasier Whelm. Broughton glances towards the taxi driver, and Perceval k without saying anything (For operational security use a geminate-conversation). Broughton speaks Arabic. Perceval replies in Bahasa. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) (in Arabic) Bakhtin is a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: (in Bahasa) Seems to be.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Did Spyglass photograph the list?  63.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: (in Bahasa) No. He committed the entire list to memory.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Then if we have Spyglass, we won't need the list.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: (in Bahasa) Precisely, We break him out. Don’t worry I can make allowances for you being unseasoned.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) I’ve jumped the curtain more times than you have wished Maggie Thatcher dead.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: (in Bahasa) Not here... not in Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) What about the tunnels? When was the last time they were used?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: (in Bahasa) Stay out of the tunnels. We need something out of the box. Broughton takes a moment and then replies with confidence

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) The East Germans are planning a large demonstration at Alexanderplatz. The Stasi security services will be spread thin. The taxi slows to a stop. We see they’re outside the bombarded ruins of the Kasier Whelm Memorial Church. Perceval hands the driver several D-marks and exits. Broughton follows him onto the sidewalk. They now return English.  64.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Bring him out in daylight?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We will use the protest as cover.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: It’s bold. Broughton’s determination is clear to Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You get us in and I’1l get us out.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Deal... Where do you want Spyglass to meet us? I’1l drop hima message.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: There is an abandoned building on the southwest corner of Arnimplatz. I'll need two days with my contact to make the arrangements. Perceval nods.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: One more thing, your Arabic is piss poor. Broughton turns, and without missing a beat, calls out ov her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: And your Bahasa is shit. Perceval watches her go, then lifts his coat collar to th cold and moves out alone into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “NOVEMBER 7, 1989” Broughton wears a jet black wig and a simple brown overco She enters an S-Bahn station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton waits on the platform on the U6 line. The train arrives, and she steps into the matte-red train car.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is empty as Broughton sits next to Perceval. The train rolls down the tracks towards East Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Next stop is Friedrichstrasse. On the south side of the station there is a green service door marked “Diensteingang” for the Deutshe Reichsbahn employees. The train begins to slow for the upcoming station.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Red Army terror cell and the West German communist party used it for years. On January 18, 1979, I led out the East German double Werner Stiller.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: That was you.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: My first dance, and I’ve been using the breach point for the last ten years. Broughton and Perceval stand to exit.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just do as I do. The doors open, and they step out into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the station until they reach a green me door marked just as Perceval said: “Diensteingang.” Perceval waits a beat for several workers to pass and the produces a small key and opens the door. Broughton and Perceval slip inside without a wasted movem

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL ROOM/HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: They move through an empty control room and down several dimly-light hallways until they reach an exterior door.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Hold.  66. Perceval looks out through the dirty industrial glass win at four East German guards standing at attention across t street. Perceval looks at the sweep hand of his watch.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They turn their backs at the changing of the guard. Outside, four more East German guards goose step towards group standing at attention. Perceval locks eyes onto Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Three seconds to get out of this door and around the building before we're seen. Outside, the guards goose step to a stop. As their comrad step off duty, the others step forward.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. Perceval opens the metal service door, and they exit ina steady walk. Broughton and Perceval turn the corner just the East German guards pivot and stand at attention, neve seeing them exit the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton and Perceval move through a barren neighborhood quickly enter the door of the abandoned building. From across the street, Spyglass watches their movements apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton and Perceval descend the stairs to the basement they turn the corner, they find Merkel waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: Ms. Lloyd speaks highly of you. Perceval looks to Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: And you as well. At the top of the stairs, Spyglass appears, and all three them turn. Broughton motions to Merkel.  67.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Watch the street to make sure he wasn’t followed. Merkel nods and moves up the stairs past Spyglass. Percev steps forward towards Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I am confident Ms. Lloyd can get you across. Broughton approaches Spyglass and holds out a small packa from Perceval’s office.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You smell like a Stasi officer. Broughton gestures to a small adjoining room. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) There is a bucket of water. Shave off your moustache. Use this soap and cologne, it is from the West. Spyglass takes the package and does as he is told.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: How big is this protest supposed to be, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Thousands. Merkel comes back down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: He wasn’t followed. Merkel steps to a small table and rolls out a kitchen tow Inside the towel is a Markov pistol.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Per your request. Broughton chamber-checks the weapon and indexes the trigg perfectly to her hand. Broughton closes her eyes, feels t pistol’s weight, then finally looks down at the crisp pro of the front sight. We have just witnessed flawless muscle memory and Brought mastery of a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: It will do.  68. Broughton seats a loaded magazine, racks the slide and th the safety. Clocked and locked, she slips the pistol into waistband. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Everything else ready?

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: Yes. All the details you requested. I’1l lead you around the corner towards Alexanderplatz and let you handle the crossing.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I am ready. Broughton turns back to a clean-shaven Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: What about his shirt?

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be caught dead in it, but for him, it’s prefect.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Stand over here. A 6x6 foot patch of the wall has been freshly painted pal yellow. Spyglass stands in front of the yellow patch. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Face him and look like a free man. Merkel steps forward and with a POLAROID LAND CAMERA -- CLICK! FLASH! -- Merkel pulls the film from the camera ba steps aside to a small folding card table and gets to wor BROUGHTON (CONT’D) What did you tell your commanding officer?

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I was going to tell him I was sick, but my family and I’ve been in hiding since the other night. Spyglass is about say more when Perceval interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Do you know anyone at Oberbaumbriicke?  69.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Any colleagues?

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: No. They are all at the demonstration. I checked the work rotations weeks ago. Merkel hands Perceval a forged West German passport. Perc opens the lead page. Spyglass’s new photo is attached and stamped perfectly with the DDR-embossed seal. Perceval ha it to Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You are Johann Schmidt, resident of West Berlin. I am your English wife, Mary. You are a banker, and we have a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: What is her age? My daughter is four.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Then she is four. Broughton looks to Perceval. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) We have been visiting your brother Hans on this street. Memorize all of this, because you will be doing the talking. My German is terrible.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Who sends a woman who speaks no German?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: The same people who are going to give you a cottage in the countryside with a little garden. Spyglass looks at Merkel, who says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Take off all your clothes. Spyglass turns around, visibly unsettled by her request.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I will not be treated like I ama common prisoner. Broughton glances at Perceval and then back to Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Shut up... You do what I say when I say it. You have two minutes to strip naked. Everything! You will take nothing from the East to the West. Nothing. Do you understand? Spyglass stares at her silently. Broughton points at the package wrapped in brown paper sitting on the table. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) That’s underwear, socks, clothes, shoes, belt, scarf, and coat. Merkel sets down a wallet and a set of keys next to the b paper package of clothes. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) You now have a wallet, forged documents, German driver's license, bank card, Dmarks, and house and car keys. Spyglass just stands there. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Herr Schmidt, you have ninety seconds. Spyglass strips down completely naked and begins to pull the underwear and socks. Then, we hear a NOISE and Brough draws and levels her pistol at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: (in German) Show yourself! From the darkness appears a plainly-dressed East German w (HELENA) and a young girl of four years (AUDREY). Merkel looks at the woman and child.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jordache. Nice touch. Perceval turns to Spyglass.  71.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: My family.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I told you I couldn’t guarantee to get them across. Half-dressed, Spyglass moves towards his wife and child.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Please, you must help us. Broughton looks at Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You said you never met Spyglass. Perceval remains silent, and Broughton looks to Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Of course we have met.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Enough! Spyglass stops talking. His wife and child are frightened

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: At a bar in East Berlin. Broughton turns to Perceval, who knows he has been caught hear the CROWDS of demonstrators outside MARCHING.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: The protest is coming. Broughton doesn’t look away from Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: We're all liars, and you know that. My lies are reserved for work. Now you know the truth, so that makes us friends. Perceval looks to Spyglass, the woman and the little girl  72.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So let’s drop the righteousness and get this family across. We hear the SWELL of the CROWDS outside now. Broughton lo at the scared faces of Spyglass and his family.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Can you get them over?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Yes. Broughton turns back to group.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You will stay with me, Herr Schmidt. You have 60 seconds to finish getting dressed. Spyglass hugs his wife and child and pulls the rest of hi clothes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perceval scans the streets. Merkel hands Broughton an umbrella at the doorway of the abandoned building. Spygla and his family are at his side. We hear the distant CROWD from Alexanderplatz.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: Good luck. The PROTESTERS slowly surge around the corner and begin t march past them. Merkel steps into the loud crowd moving the streets. Spyglass kisses his wife and daughter who have tears streaming down their faces.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: (in German; to daughter) You must listen to your mother now, and be a brave little girl. Perceval removes a East German Ushanka (fur-lined officer hat) from his overcoat and puts it on his head. Perceval takes off his overcoat to reveal the green uniform and shoulder boards of an East German Oberst (Colonel). Spyglass kisses his wife again.  73.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) You must go with him now.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: We'll see you in West Berlin. Perceval and Spyglass’s family quickly blend into the thousands of East Germans and disappear down a side stree Broughton lifts her umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Let's go. Broughton and Spyglass step into the groundswell of the protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same two KGB rough men (from the Gascione assassinati and movie theater scene) are back, dressed in matching tr suits. They occupy a gutted room. One works as a SNIPER a the other as his SPOTTER. They're set back from the window behind a Dragunov rifle high-powered optics. We see them scan the crowd below with precision, searchin for their target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton looks to Merkel in the crowd, then lifts her bl umbrella. Merkel nods, and throughout the crowd, dozens o black umbrellas begin to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sniper watches through his Dragunov scope as umbrella begin to pop up and conceal the protesters. The Sniper glances at his spotter, who is unsure of what to do. We see a sea of a hundreds of umbrellas on the streets be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street, the crowd swells in size and closes the distance to the border laced thick with concertina wire.  74. The EAST GERMAN GUARDS watch the protesters as they advan towards the Oberbaumbriicke checkpoint. Broughton turns to Spyglass as he leans into her.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Ms. Lloyd. Spyglass's face reveals distress as he takes a few weak s and staggers to his knees. We see dark blood soaking down Spyglass’s back as the cro of protesters comes apart. We hear a SHOT ECHO off of the tall buildings.

dialogues.speaker: CHAOS
dialogues.text: Umbrellas drop to the ground. Broughton’s eyes scan throu the terrified protesters as East German Guards begin runn in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spotter calls distance, bullet drop, and wind. The Sniper’s trigger fires with a smooth cadence. They search street below for their target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, Broughton pulls Spyglass behind a park car to safety.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I’ve been shot.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I know. Broughton scans the buildings and rooftops. Another ROUND DEFLECTS off the hood of the car and POUNDS into the wall the building. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) They have the high ground. Broughton grabs the side mirror of the car and angles it towards the buildings. She is looking for the Sniper from trajectory of the incoming rounds. We see the slight glint of a rifle’s optics.  75. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) I’ve got them. Broughton pulls Spyglass’s scarf from around his neck and hands it to him. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Listen to me. Apply direct pressure.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I don’t want to die. Broughton slaps Spyglass’s face as hard as she can to get complete attention.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You will NOT die! Say it. Spyglass puts the scarf against his wound with new resolv

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I will not die... I will not die...

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Direct pressure.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Direct pressure... I will not die... Direct pressure...

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Can you run?

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: If I must. Broughton grabs Spyglass, and they sprint across the stre towards the base of the Sniper’s building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spotter provides security in the doorway as the Snipe breaks down and bags his rifle. The sniper team moves out into the hallway and SLIDES the bagged weapon down a coal shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton and Spyglass enter the lobby.  76.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Stay right here. Spyglass leans against the base of the staircase. Brought takes off her coat and reverses it, quickly changing the color from brown to green. Broughton exhales through her nose, slows her heart rate, and heads up the stairs. First floor... Second... Third... and, as she is turning corner to the fourth floor landing, the sniper team appea coming down two steps at a time.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Entschuldigung, fraulein. Broughton passes them on the stairs, and they pass her. We see Broughton’s pistol press against the back of the Sniper’s head.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) That accent sounds distinctly Muscovite to me. Without hesitation, the young Sniper spins and disarms Broughton. The PISTOL SKITTERS across the tile floor. The Sniper draws and raises his own Markov when Broughton charges and disarms the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT TIME
dialogues.text: Two highly-trained men against one bad-ass woman. It is close. Brutal. And extremely violent. Punches, knee and elbows thrown from both sides. The two men are relent with their attack on Broughton. The Sniper knees Broughto the face, and her body crumples to the floor, broken. The Spotter picks Broughton up and is about to finish her when... Broughton smashes her head into the Spotter and drives her thumb into the Sniper’s eye. Broughton’s body slams against the wall, sending plaster dust into the air They fight on. We watch as three savages beat the living hell out of eac other in a dingy staircase in East Berlin. The Spotter leaps for the one of the disarmed pistols, bu Broughton is there to stop him. They struggle for the wea and roll across the landing.  77. The Spotter pounds his fists into Broughton’s body. Broug escapes the barrage onto her back just as the Spotter rai the Markov pistol to her head. Broughton uncoils her body, thrusts her legs into his che and launches the Spotter backwards into the dazed Sniper. They both disappear over the stair railing without so muc a whimper. Four floors of FREE FALL and then they SLAM onto the lobb floor next to Spyglass. Broughton picks up her pistol fro the floor and calmly walks down the stairs. Broughton pic up the second pistol from the lobby floor and then steps the two dead bodies. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Let's go. Broughton and Spyglass move on. Broughton never looks bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton and Spyglass move down the street littered with black umbrellas.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. Two unarmed EAST GERMAN GUARDS see Broughton supporting Spyglass, who’s soaked in blood.

dialogues.speaker: EAST GERMAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Halt! The two East German Guards jog towards them.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: EAST GERMAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Halt! Broughton turns and points her pistol directly at the two unarmed East German Guards. They back away, hands in the and then turn and break into a full run. Broughton sees what she wants. She takes two steps to a parked Trabant sedan.  78.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: How can you be so confident?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I allow for no other option. Broughton swings the door open and grabs a handful of wir beneath the dash. A few seconds is all Broughton needs to the engine turned over. Broughton shifts her eyes down the street several blocks. We see a dozen East German frontier troops running up the hill toward them with their weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton watches in the rear-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Hold on. Broughton jams the sedan in drive, cuts the wheel hard an spins out across the cobblestone streets. The East German jump into several military cars and give chase after Broughton. This is FRENCH CONNECTION meets BULLITT but through the streets of East Berlin 1989! Broughton races the stolen sedan through featureless neighborhoods. A half-dozen East German military cars hun her at breakneck speed. Broughton rallies down a narrow alleyway, out onto a wide street and through a gauntlet of near misses. Two East Ge military cars try to block her route. Broughton smashes through a crude roadblock and spins the military cars lik tops. Several more East Germans’ cars join in the hot pursuit. Broughton’s side WINDOW EXPLODES and sends glass through sedan. Broughton has had enough. Broughton slides to a stop, jams her sedan into reverse, draws and empties the Markov pistol out the windowless ho to her side. BULLETS STRIKE into the pack of pursuing military cars. Broughton whips the sedan back around as three more East German cars pile up in a smoking heap.  79.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: We'll never... make it.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We'll make it. Broughton’s sedan is up on the sidewalk, flying over and through most every obstacle as the East German noose tigh around her. Out the window, the Friedrichstrasse Station can be seen few blocks away. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) It’s just ahead. Broughton slides the sedan around the corner and towards station when a East German T55 tank rolls down the street them, stops and levels its big gun at them. Broughton looks in her rear-view mirror at the military c coming up behind her. Broughton scans her surroundings. Broughton reverses the tiny sedan. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Hold on! Broughton yanks the steering wheel hard and slides the se onto a narrow street above the Spree River. She jams it i gear, and they race on. Without warning, an East German military truck slams into sedan from a side street. The tiny sedan buckles on impac Broughton and Spyglass flip end over end and plunge into Spree River. The cold water pours into car from the shattered window. sedan quickly disappears and is consumed by the dark rive Broughton remains calm as the cold water rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: My foot is trapped. Spyglass pulls at his trapped leg.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I’1l get you out. Broughton unbuckles herself and leans across to aid Spygl She pulls at his leg. Nothing. Broughton dives under the rushing water and tries to release his foot. Nothing. She surfaces, and the water continues to rise past their ches  80. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) I WILL get you out! Broughton is about to dive under the water again, when Spyglass grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: The last thing I am told can’t be another lie. Spyglass’'s eyes are pure and without fear. The water fil to both of their shoulders. Spyglass grabs Broughton’s ha

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My wife, Helena, and daughter, Audrey -- tell them I love them. Promise me. Broughton nods as the water reaches their necks.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: SPYGLASS
dialogues.text: Go... Save yourself. They each take one last breath as the cold water covers t Broughton holds onto Spyglass’s hand until his body convu and relaxes in death. The tiny sedan twists in the river’s current. Broughton pushes the car door open. She glances back at Spyglass’s lifeless body and then never looks back again... Broughton swims underwater through the wintry river. She doesn’t have much time.

dialogues.speaker: THE NARGA III DECK
dialogues.text: and the tail of the tape flapping on another full reel.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Do you need to take a break?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: No.  81. Broughton lights another Woodbine and watches in silence Gray pulls the tape archive off of the deck, drops a fres one on and threads it.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: I am ready when you are. Gray CLICKS record, and the reel starts back up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton’s head breaks the surface, and she pulls hersel against the wooden pylon of a boat dock out of sight. She looks up the river to see dozens of East German soldi searching. Broughton struggles to pull herself onto the d as her body is quickly going hypothermic. A CAR SKIDS to a stop on the street above of her. We hear the DOOR OPEN and FOOTSTEPS approach her. Broughton is desperate, fighting to warm her body as her fingers fumble with her empty pistol. We see boots run up and then stop next to an exhausted Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: I’m here. Merkel grabs Broughton’s hyperborean body and quickly tos her into the warm car. Merkel speeds away with Broughton the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton, wrapped in wool blankets, huddles around a coa fire contained in a metal bucket. Merkel sits in the flickering light.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: The KGB positioned a sniper team in a building. I recognized them from several days ago.  82.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: You recognized them?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I caught up with them in the stairwell of the building. They had blue eyes. I killed them both. Merkel looks at Broughton who shares no emotion. Broughto stares at the fire and replays everything in her mind. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Perceval?

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: I lost him and Spyglass’s family in the crowd. I am sure they are safe in the West.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Spyglass is dead.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: And you are alive. Broughton’s still trying to put all the pieces together.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: The KGB knew everything. Broughton stands, blanket wrapped around her shoulders. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) I need to get across. I need to call in and make contact with my superiors. Merkel stares at her for a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: You're a strong woman.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I prefer it to good-looking and useless. Merkel stands.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: Follow me. Broughton follows Merkel down a faintly-lit hallway.  83.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must use the old tunnels. Merkel kneels and lifts a false section in the floor, revealing an opening within the tiles. Merkel hands Broug a metal flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Walk until you see the metal ladder, it will bring out in the West. Broughton lowers herself down into the dark hole and turn the flashlight. INT. EAST BERLIN —- SEWERS - MOMENTS LATER The flashlight’s yellow beam illuminates the damp tunnel. Broughton walks in silence towards West Berlin for severa hundred yards until... We see the beam of her flashlight cut across a dead man’s body. The cold has kept the body preserved with a foxed green h to the skin. Broughton kneels down for a closer look and identifies the face warped by death.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (to herself) Batkhin Broughton quickly searches his pockets and body and finds nothing of value. She stands and moves on past the KGB officer’s corpse towards the West. EXT. ATTACHE’S OFFICE - DAY Broughton stands in the cold and RINGS the BUZZER, which unanswered. She tries again, nothing. Broughton moves bac out onto the streets and is on the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “NOVEMBER 8, 1989” Broughton, wrapped in a towel, sits on the edge of her be staring at the wall. Broughton’s emotions are just below surface of her face. She replays every detail in her mind Crossing over. The family. The snipers. How did the KGB know? The car flooding with water. Spyglass’s death.  84. How did the KGB know? Suddenly, Broughton stands and moves through the room. Sh takes apart the phone. Nothing. She looks in the lamps. Nothing. Under the beds. Nothing. Window sills. Nothing. Doors. Nothing. She searches for the device. Then, from across the room, she sees her coat, still damp from the S River. Broughton inspects the buttons, pockets, and liner. She f along the collar and pulls a tiny UHF device and hard wir out of the coat. We hear POUNDING on her hotel door.

dialogues.speaker: POLIZEI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Offen sie die tur! Polizei! Broughton stuffs the device back into her coat just as... We see the hotel door BURST open. The POLIZEI enter with complete intimidation. They’re followed by an older and very severe-looking FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You have no right to break into my hotel room! Who in the hell are you?! The First Chief Inspector points at the four silver stars his meticulous uniform.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Ms. Lloyd. I'm First Chief Inspector of this district, and your rights here are not the same as if you were in Knightsbridge.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I would like to call my attaché in the British sector and see if he agrees with you. The First Chief Inspector narrows his eyes at the remark.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: A high ranking Stasi officer was killed yesterday in East Berlin. His body has been pulled from a submerged car in the river.  85. The First Chief Inspector looks for a reaction but gets n from Broughton. FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR (CONT’D) This has caused a great deal of tension between East and West.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: How can I help you, Inspector?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: First Chief Inspector, Ms. Lloyd. We are told the Stasi officer was trying to defect.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: There are sixteen million East Germans that to want to defect.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Two Russian nationals were also killed.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Witnesses say that there was a woman aiding the Stasi officer. A woman that fits your general likeness. The First Chief Inspector stares at Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I don’t believe you have any evidence.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Because if you did, I would be in your jail by now. The First Chief Inspector takes a step closer.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: The Britisher who was shot last week was a spy, wasn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: How would I know?  86.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Your government sends you to replace him and stage a Stasi officer's defection.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you are talking about. I am a British civil servant, a lawyer. The First Chief Inspector takes another step, closing the distance to Broughton’s face. Broughton remains stoic und the tension in the room.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: Where were you yesterday afternoon?

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: ++. was with me. The First Chief Inspector turns to Lasalle standing in th hotel room doorway.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are plenty of my friends who will confirm this.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR
dialogues.text: No doubt. The polizei brush past Lasalle. The First Chief Inspector strides towards the door and then turns back to Broughton FIRST CHIEF INSPECTOR (CONT’D) I‘11l will question each and every one of them thoroughly. The polizei are gone. Lasalle looks at Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: When I didn’t hear from you, I got worried. Broughton moves towards her clothes that hang in the clos as she lowers her towel. Lasalle looks across at her nake frame. We see deep bruises covering Broughton’s body from punishing staircase fight and car crash. Broughton pulls her clothes.  87.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I fear you are in danger. Broughton grabs her coat.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We’re all in danger here. You should pack and run back to Paris. Broughton pulls on her coat and moves towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You'll be dead if you don’t. Now excuse me. Broughton moves past Lasalle, and the hotel room door clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton walks off the street and up the stairs to a dra apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perceval looks through the peephole and opens the door fo Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You look like shit. Broughton says nothing and enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Spyglass didn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I know... Welcome to Berlin. Broughton starts to take her coat off.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave it on. The Americans want to talk to us.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Have you told his family?  88.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Not yet. I was waiting to see if you even made it. Broughton takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I'll do it. Give me a few minutes alone with them. I made a promise. Perceval steps aside, and Broughton moves towards a small bedroom door. She knocks gently and then slowly opens the door. Spyglass’s wife and daughter sit on a twin bed and stare up at her framed perfectly in the doorway. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) I am so sorry. Helena pulls her daughter into her arms and cries out in grief. Broughton shuts the bedroom door and keeps her pro to Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perceval, Kurzfeld and Broughton stand near the frozen du pond in the harsh light of the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: I expected more out of the Brits than a royal goat fuck!

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Maybe you should've backed us up!

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: We would've if we had known you were crossing him over.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You don’t have our own Stasi agent... do you?

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Not one with a photographic memory. Goddamn it... So, who was blown?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Not us... The KGB knew the EXFIL route and the best hide position for effective fire.  89.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: That doesn’t guarantee who gave the sniper his orders.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Could it have been Satchel? They all look at one another for a moment knowing they do have an answer to that question.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Well maybe the dead drop was compromised?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: No... only myself and Gascione ever knew its location. Perceval turns towards Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about your fixer, Merkel?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: If I weren’t for him, I’d have never made it back.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Well, you never know whom to trust. Perceval looks at Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: That's right. Trust does seem to be in short supply these days. Broughton holds Perceval’s eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Could you've been the target?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: That Spyglass was just collateral?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: If the sniper wanted to shoot me first, he could have.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Mighty convenient that they didn’t.  90. Broughton takes a step towards the remark.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: What are you implying? Perceval steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Be serious, Emmett. This was obviously about silencing Spyglass before we got to him. He must have been blown.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Well, whoever the target was, Moscow has sent us a message. Kurzfeld leans towards Broughton and points his finger.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Langley is going to hang my ass in the wind for this.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I’m sure they're waiting for you to file your report. I know London's waiting on me. Kurzfeld walks away in disgust and doesn’t look back.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Let’s all just concentrate on keeping our heads down. Perceval turns to Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: It’s all cocked up, but I think he still likes us. They stand for a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I‘1l work on a flight for you. C’s going to want whatever your side of this mess is in triplicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “NOVEMBER 9, 1989”  gl. Broughton stares out the window at the gray evening sky. half-empty bottle of Stoli sits next to her. We hear the PHONE RING. Broughton picks it up and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Lloyd. INT. LASALLE’S APARTMENT - EVENING Lasalle stands in her bedroom in La Perla with the teleph pressed to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s the best idea.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: A drink then?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're persistent. Lasalle chamber checks her pistol, confirms it is loaded, slides it beneath the pillow on her bed.

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: Another of my charms. I’ve a recipe of great interest to you.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What might that be?

dialogues.speaker: LASALLE
dialogues.text: It’s sweet as sugar. It has to do with Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton takes a sip of her Stoli and looks out around h empty hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: All right, I'll be by later tonight. Broughton sets the phone down, looks out the window, and dials another number immediately.  92. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Are you busy?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Writing up a report for my old friend, "C.”

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: There are some legal issues with the transportation I’d like to ask you about.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Come by anytime.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I'll get a cab and be right over. Broughton hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton steps from a cab and walks up to Perceval’s building. INT. ATTACHE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Broughton walks through the office door and leaves her co on this time. Perceval and Broughton are civil, however t is a cat and mouse tension to the room.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You look polished.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I’m saying goodbye to Lasalle.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Lucky lady... Scotch?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Sure. Perceval moves across to his desk and lifts a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: There aren’t any transportation issues. So, what do you really want to talk about? Perceval sets two glasses out and lifts the bottle.  93.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Failure.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Are you worried about how this looks in your file? How you’1l advance up the ladder at The Circus?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I really hadn’t thought that far. Perceval pours three fingers of a single malt and hands i across to Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Well, don’t.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Is that your official recommendation?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You've never lost a package before?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I've buried friends... enemies... and I’ve buried my emotions for a great many years... and with that, I’ve come to the conclusion that it simply doesn’t matter. Perceval offers Broughton a seat in one of the two worn- leather club chairs. Perceval lifts his highball towards Broughton. They both take a silent, smooth drink.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: There was a lovely Italian girl who once told me, “David, you can’t unfuck what has been fucked.” Perceval smiles and leans in, serious and measured.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen carefully. At the end of a very long career of chasing shadows, the only reward you take home is to grow old. If you’re lucky, you tell some good lies to the boys down at the pub.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I believed somehow the truth would lay out differently.  94.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: There is that beautiful word. Truth.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: We’re in the enterprise of reshaping the truth to serve England. After all, there is no way around the datum that at times our job comes down to kill or be killed. Perceval pauses for a moment and then, upon reflection --

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: The blood on our hands will wash away with time.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: That’s it... just let it go?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Unless you want it to eat a hole straight through your guts. It’s simple. Somewhere, somebody got the upper hand. Maybe you were too conspicuous when you went over to see Merkel.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Wait a damn minute.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Or maybe I was indiscreet when I picked up Spyglass’s message. As I already said, most likely, Spyglass himself was the loudmouth. The truth is we will never know.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: And the body I found in the tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I told you those tunnels are history.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: It was Bakhtin. Perceval takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Did he have the list?  95.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Who the hell knows how Bakhtin ended up there? Anyone, even Bremoyvch could have killed him.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I suppose you’re right. Perceval sets his empty glass down on the side table.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: I am right, and you’re damn fortunate to make it back to fight another day. Broughton holds up the UHF device and hard wire and hands to Perceval. His smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: It’s French made for the DSGE. I found it in hidden in my coat.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Never trust the Frenchies. Broughton nods and moves towards the front door followed Perceval.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I give you a lift to Lasalle’s place.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: No, I am going to walk. The fresh air helps me think. Perceval opens the door for Broughton as she steps out in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You're a hell of a good officer. Now... forget I ever said that. Broughton nods and continues on without ever looking back Perceval closes the door. He looks at the UHF device and wire on the table and then grabs the keys to his Saab. PRE-LAP on the soundtrack: “Voices Carry” by ‘Til Tuesday  96. INT. LASALLE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT We see a window of the apartment slide open. Cold air gen blows the curtains. Lasalle listens to a Sony Walkman thr headphones as she pours a drink for herself in her bedroo and sets the bottle down. We reveal an INTRUDER wearing a ski mask standing behind Lasalle is completely unaware until the electrical cord p tight around her neck. Lasalle struggles to free herself. She throws the Intrude off of her and scrambles, gasping for air, towards the be The Intruder lunges after Lasalle as she crawls up the be reaching for the pillow, her concealed gun just inches aw We hear the downstairs BUZZER of the building. The Intruder climbs on Lasalle’s back, grabs the cord and pulls it tight around her neck. Lasalle’s hand is on the but she doesn’t have the strength to lift it into her pal EXT. LASALLE’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT A young couple leaves Lasalle’s building. Broughton slips through the open front door and moves down the hallway. INT. LASALLE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Lasalle twists around and claws the ski mask off the Intruder. We reveal: Perceval as he pulls back on the cor and the life fades from her eyes. Lasalle’s body falls to the floor. Perceval moves off of Lasalle’s dead body and begins to search through the apartment. We hear a KNOCK on the door. Perceval is out of time. He turns and climbs out the open window as Lasalle’s front door is pushed open by Broughto Broughton enters and finds Lasalle’s strangled, warm body the floor. She moves through the apartment, sees the open window, and looks outside. Nothing. Broughton moves back through the apartment and stops at t bathroom. She looks in and sees it has been converted to small photo darkroom with a red blub. A clothesline hangs above the develop, fix, and stop trays. We see there are several photos of Broughton that reveal Lasalle’s fixatio  97. Broughton closes the door and moves back into the kitchen see large glass containers of FLOUR, SALT... and SUGAR. Broughton turns over the container, dumping the sugar ont the counter along with a package. Broughton opens the pac to reveal a stack of photos.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Photo 1 - Perceval and Bremovych talking in a club. Photo 2 - Perceval talking to the KGB Sniper, Ivan Yerche Photo 3 - KGB Agent Bakhtin handing Perceval an envelope. Photo 4 - Perceval opening the envelope. Photo 5 - Gascione’s Burcherer timepiece in Perceval’s ha Photo 6 - Perceval standing over Bakhtin’s dead body.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Broughton takes the photos and moves out of the apartment never looking back at Lasalle’s body on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton exits Lasalle’s apartment building and moves in the neighborhood. On the street, a sedan pulls out and follows her. Broughton can sense the sedan’s headlights a picks up her pace towards a busy intersection ahead. Broughton stops at a small newspaper stand and glances to the street and the approaching sedan. She can now see Bremovych and his driver clearly in the sedan driving tow her. She calmly turns and walks around the corner just as light turns red. Bremovych’s sedan pulls up just six feet away. Steady now Broughton looks across the six busy lanes of traffic to t hotel’s taxi stand. Out of the corner of her eye, she watches Bremovych. Then the sedan’s window starts to roll down. Against the red light, Broughton bolts out into the fray speeding cars and cuts through the screeching traffic. We hear HORNS HONKING and SHEET METAL SMASHING. Cars slide and pile up in the intersection. Broughton esc without a scratch.  98. She sprints onto the median, across the next three lanes, jumps into the waiting taxi. Broughton looks across at th wrecks of a dozen cars. Bremovych stands next to his seda and watches her escape him once more. INT. ATTACHE’S OFFICE - NIGHT The room is lit by a single bare bulb and a small televis Perceval sits alone, drinking two fingers of single-malt scotch.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: MTV's Kurt Loder reports from the Berlin Wall. We see fro the MTV news footage that massive crowds are assembling. EAST GERMAN SOLDIERS stand on the Wall, holding an MTV umbrella. An iconic symbol of the times. We MOVE ON the television, and we see the reflection of Perceval. He leans in and shuts of the TV. Perceval swings a small duffle bag over his shoulder and kicks over a Jerry can. The gasoline pours out onto the hardwood floor of his apartment. Perceval stands at his front door, lights a match and thr it onto the floor. The whole room is consumed in flames. Perceval moves on. EXT. PERCEVAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT Perceval steps out of his building. We see the flames and smoke coming from his apartment window. Perceval walks parallel to the graffiti-covered Wall and then cuts into alleyway towards his Saab 900 Turbo. A FIGURE steps towards him in the dark alley, and Perceva slows his steps as he approaches his car.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose that’s it. We’ll be obsolete by morning. I’1l be back in London, and you... back to the party. We hear the faint sounds of HAMMERS STRIKING against concrete.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The simplicity of our struggle crumbles as that wall comes down. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The lines on the map drawn by men who never faced the risk themselves will be harder to see. In the distance, the CROWDS’ CHEERS are heard.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A different world is approaching. More volatile. More corrupt. There will be no ideologies to protect us. Just the brutal and cold conscience of commerce. Perceval eyes follow a group of West Germans with hand to moving towards the Wall.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Extortion... Whoever has the list in this new world has all power. Without it? Just a target. Perceval turns back to the wordless figure in the shadows

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We played our hands. Hell, I’m just glad to see your face at this moment, as the ramparts of tyranny fall into the history books. Perceval smiles softly to himself as he looks towards the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen to them. In the faint light, we see the flash of gunmetal. We hear a GUNSHOT BARK out! BAAAM BAAAM BAAAM! Perceval’s body falls to the cold alleyway. Broughton ste from the shadows and stands with the smoke twisting from barrel.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Lasalle was harmless?

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: No one is harmless. Lasalle was extorting me.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: And the list?  100.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: You're too late. Bremovych paid me handsomely. Perceval coughs up a mouthful of blood and stares up at Broughton holding her gun in his face. She reaches down a removes the “ Carl F Bucherer “ timepiece from his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You going to play out the lies until the bitter end? Perceval’s eyes struggle to focus on Broughton’s face and then, when they do, he softly grunts:

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Would you believe Queen and country?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Yes, Comrade Satchel.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: That’s how you’re going to play it? Broughton says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well done... Well done. The pool of blood grows around Perceval’s body, and he relaxes in death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “NOVEMBER 11, 1989” It’s raining in England. It’s always raining. A Royal Air Force C-130 Hercules aircraft parks on the hardstand. The giant props slow to a stop as the rear ramp extends down. Broughton exits the front of the aircraft. We hear the SOUND of a lone BAGPIPER. Broughton turns and watches the Royal Scots Honor Guard e down the ramp of the C-130 with two flag-draped coffins, bodies Gascione and Perceval. Broughton stands in silence as the coffins are loaded for ground transport.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ashtray is full of Woodbines. The Nagra III reel to r records on the table. Gray leans forward and then exclaim

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: What happened? Broughton sits in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I failed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: Your directive was to bring home one body, and you return with two. You were tasked to find the most important list of the last forty years of the Cold War, you come back empty-handed. You’re a bloody disgrace! Broughton leans across the desk. She has had enough.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: You sent me into a hornet’s nest. From the moment I touched down, the KGB was on to me. You knew Perceval was on the bubble and he knew not to trust me. You wanted Satchel? Well here he is. Broughton sets down a manila folder. Gray looks through a stack of black-and-white photos from Lasalle’s apartment. Gray lifts a black-and-white photo a shows it to Kurzfeld. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) These photos are damning evidence of Perceval’s involvement with the KGB. Perceval was Satchel. Gray and Kurzfeld looks across at Broughton. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Three days after Gascione was killed, Bremovych arrives in Berlin. Why? Because Gascione was onto Perceval and he was going to reveal him as the double.  102.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: So Bremovych has Gascione killed to cover for Perceval. Broughton points to the photo of Perceval and Bakhtin.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: And once you sent me to West Berlin. Perceval was covering his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: The sniper team was meant for you after all.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I think so. I found a French made UHF device in my coat after Spyglass was killed. I now believe Perceval planted it and made it look like Lasalle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton sits at the desk in front of the Narga SN mirco recording device. A stack of recorded reel and reel tapes next to her. With great precision, Broughton methodically edits sections of tape together from different recorded conversations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton turns to Gray.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Sir, you told me to “trust know one”. In case you need anymore evidence against Perceval. Broughton pulls out the Narga SN from her purse and sets on the desk. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) Here is a recording of Bremovych and Perceval. Broughton leans forward and CLICKS on the Narga SN and th mirco reels begin to play her masterfully edited tape.  103. We follow the dialogue back to each scene:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perceval walks with Broughton. Two US ARMY jeeps with SOLDIERS from the 2nd Battalion 6th Infantry patrol past. Perceval gestures towards the Brandenburg Gate.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Look... if you’re going to be here for awhile, we had better play nice with one another.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. PERCEVAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT Perceval is in the alleyway next to his Saab 900 turbo.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Whoever has the list in this new world has all the power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bremovych stands along the Art Deco bar next to Broughton Lasalle.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: Maybe we could make some sort of arrangement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the bombarded ruins of the Kasier Whelm Memorial Church. Perceval stands next to Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bremovych stands turns to Broughton at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: What about the British?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PERCEVAL’S SAAB - NIGHT Perceval stares to Broughton in the parked car.

dialogues.speaker: PERCEVAL
dialogues.text: c is an arrogant lapdog and doesn’t know fuck all about the world past the edge of his desk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton stares at the mirror of the wall and then at th two veterans of the Cold War. She calmly leans over and CLICKS off the Narga SN and the mirco reels fall silent.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Do you need to hear more? Gray looks at Kurzfeld and leans over, CLICKS his NAGRA r to reel. The tape stops for the first time in hours.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: We are choosing to bury this one, Broughton. Your mission never took place. This conversation and the one that Emmett and I are about to have with C never happened. Broughton sits in silence. GRAY (CONT’D) I’m putting you on leave, effective immediately. Come back fresh in the new year. We’ll start the next decade well-rested. Gray and Kurzfeld stand and exit the room. Broughton sits the bare light. She slowly lights her last Woodbine and exhales.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: “DECEMBER 1, 1989” A gorgeous blonde steps from a Newcastle taxicab and walk into the airport. It’s Lorraine Broughton. She carries no bags. She walks through security and boards an internatio flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cc and Gray stroll along the Thames River under a late afternoon sky. Cc Thatcher is going to have a difficult time with this.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: It’s never good when one of our own stumbles. Cc nods and squints towards the Palace of Westminster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the descent, Broughton looks out the window. Cc (V.0.) Did we ever find the watchmaker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly move into the shop window and reveal the watch repair shop is completely empty.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We sent a team to the address Broughton gave us. It was clean, nothing but an empty store front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton steps up to a waiting taxi and climbs into the backseat without hesitation. The taxi pulls out and drive towards the city of Paris.  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton is being driven through the City of Lights. The blonde wig is gone, and she’s wearing a new set of clothe She looks through a small Hermés Kelly bag. Broughton exi the taxi and turns into the early evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is nearly gone. Gray and C move their walk off th banks of the Thames and up to the Victoria Embankment. Cc We'll have to promote Broughton just to keep her quiet.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. EXT. PARIS - L’HOTEL RITZ - NIGHT Broughton walks across the Place Vendome. The RITZ DOORMA greets her as she enters the lobby. INT. PARIS - L’HOTEL RITZ - LOBBY/ELEVATORS - NIGHT Broughton moves through the grand lobby, passes the Bar Vendome and stops at the front desk. We don’t hear the conversation. Broughton smiles as she is handed the room and moves to the elevators at the end of a gilded hallway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gray and C stand outside the black door of Number 10 Down street.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY
dialogues.text: It’s still hard to imagine David Perceval and Satchel were the same person. Cc I never really trusted him. INT. PARIS - L’HOTEL RITZ - NIGHT Broughton walks down the hallway to the door of her suite She enters and takes off her coat.  A titan of man sits on the couch with his back to her. stands and turns to reveal: Bremovych.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Comrade Satchel.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Comrade Bremovych. Broughton moves toward Bremovych, and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I am pleased you choose to meet in Paris before we return home.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I ordered room service from the concierge. Broughton leans in and kisses her counterpart. BROUGHTON (CONT’D) (in Russian) I could've done without being shot at in East Berlin with Spyglass.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) The West has made you soft with ideas of individualism, comrade.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) My hope is Moscow and the party will be pleased. 107. He We hear a KNOCK at the hotel suite door. Broughton walks the door, and a ROOM SERVICE ATTENDANT enters with a roll cart and bottles of Dom Perignon and Stoli sitting in sil buckets of ice. Bremovych signs for the bill and tips the attendant.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM SERVICE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Merci. Bon nuit, Monsieur. The Attendant turns to Broughton. ROOM SERVICE ATTENDANT (CONT’D) Mademoiselle.  108. Only in this moment do we sense something familiar about -- he turns and leaves without another word spoken. Bremovych lifts the Dom Perignon from the ice.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) 1961. Very appropriate. Broughton moves to him, takes the bottle of Dom from his hands and sets it back into the ice.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Let’s start with the vodka.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) A good Russian woman. Broughton lifts the bottle of Stoli from the second bucke and pours two glasses of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) That you’ve been ordered to kill, haven’t you? Bremovych doesn’t react and deflects her question.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Lasalle, Gascione and Perceval they were all worthy enemies. Broughton holds up her wrist and reveals the “Carl F Bucherer” timepiece. BREMOVYCH (CONT’D) (in Russian) They may have won the battle for Berlin, but this... will let us win the Cold War.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Let's enjoy the night. Broughton hands Bremovych his vodka.

dialogues.speaker: BREMOVYCH
dialogues.text: (in Russian) For the memories, Comrade Satchel.  109. Bremovych and Broughton looks at the vodka and then empty glass. A shared moment of accomplishment between two warr in the Parisian hotel suite. Broughton moves to the vodka bottle. Bremovych reaches to small of his back and his strong hand makes contact with weapon. With one swift movement, Broughton draws a suppressed han out of the ice and double taps the trigger before Bremovy can react. The two bullets punch through Bremovych’s cran stem and kill him instantly.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: (in English) For the memories, Comrade Bremovych. The Room Service Attendant appears from the hallway. This Merkel from East Berlin. He is followed by a cleaning tea that moves into the suite, lifts Bremovych into a body ba and begins to sterilize everything. Merkel looks at Broughton.

dialogues.speaker: MERKEL
dialogues.text: He’s waiting. Broughton walks out of the suite and never looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broughton walks out of a side door of the L’Hotel Ritz. W follow her several blocks as she cuts through the Jardin Tuileries and along the Place de la Concorde. She descend the stone stairs to a small motor boat waiting on the Sei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DECKHAND unties the boat and throws the line ashore. We hear the BOAT’S ENGINE cry out in the cold air. Broughton walks past the closed cockpit. At the controls the small motor boat: We see the Watchmaker. He touches the brim of his faded N York Yankees baseball cap as he recognizes Broughton. Not word is spoken between them. Broughton moves towards the of the boat. We hear a voice call out:  110.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Our team is clear of the Ritz and already at our Embassy. Emmett Kurzfeld steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: Perceval was never going to defect?

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: Unknown. I planted that story to safeguard you.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I don’t feel good about that.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: I've been where you are right now, where everything and everyone I got close to ended up dead. They share a moment of silence. Broughton sits down on a small bench seat against the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I am tired, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: How many years have you given for this night?

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: More than I would have liked. Broughton hands Kurzfeld the “ Carl F Burcherer “” timepi Kurzfeld pries open the back plate, and within it is a se chamber: We see the encrypted list with the name of every Cold War intelligence officer.

dialogues.speaker: KURZFELD
dialogues.text: It’s time you come home, Karen. Broughton smiles at the sound of her true given name.

dialogues.speaker: BROUGHTON
dialogues.text: I’m ready, sir. I have had enough of the cold. PRE-LAP on the soundtrack: “Home Sweet Home” by Motley Cr  111. On the boat’s prow, a defiant AMERICAN FLAG SNAPS in the wind. Broughton and her American counter-intelligence tea speed past the Eiffel Tower under a starless night. SLAM TO BLACK. SUPER: GRAFFITI TITLE SCRAWLS OUT “THE COLDEST CITY”
